intro: Holostigma heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable holostigma, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive foliage, which features alternate, palmately lobed leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, pentagonal flowers with five petals and stamens, typically in shades of pink to purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its unique appearance.
